messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using JavaScript and the Express.js framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/orderRoutes.js`, I found that `orderController.createOrder` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/orderRoutes.js`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `orderController.createOrder`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

{'stdout': 'total 44
drwxr-xr-x 9 user user 4096 Jan  1  1970 .
drwxr-xr-x 4 user user 4096 Dec 26 13:07 ..
drwxr-xr-x 2 user user 4096 Jan  1  1970 config
drwxr-xr-x 2 user user 4096 Jan  1  1970 controllers
drwxr-xr-x 2 user user 4096 Jan  1  1970 data
drwxr-xr-x 2 user user 4096 Jan  1  1970 middleware
drwxr-xr-x 2 user user 4096 Jan  1  1970 models
drwxr-xr-x 2 user user 4096 Jan  1  1970 routes
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user 1299 Jan  1  1970 seeder.js
-rw-r--r-- 1 user user 1564 Jan  1  1970 server.js
drwxr-xr-x 2 user user 4096 Jan  1  1970 utils
', 'stderr': ''}

function.arguments: {"command":"ls -la routes && ls -la controllers && ls -la middleware && ls -la models"}
function.name: run_command
